did.unittitle: Two Girl Working Collection, 2002-2011
did.abstract: Publicity and other printed material about Trappings: Stories of Women, Power and Clothing, a collaborative project by Two Girls Working whose principals are Tiffany Ludwig and Renee Piechocki.

processinfo.p: By: Tiffany Ludwig and Renee Piechocki

acqinfo.p: The collection of Two Girls Working was given to the Schlesinger Library in October 2012 by Tiffany Ludwig and Renee Piechocki.

userestrict.p: Copyright. Copyright in the papers created by Two Girls Working is held by Two Girls Working LLC, Tiffany Ludwig and Renee Piechocki. Copyright in other papers in the collection may be held by their authors, or the authors' heirs or assigns.
Copying. Papers may be copied in accordance with the library's usual procedures.

prefercite.p: Two Girls Working Collection, 2002-2011; item description, dates. 2012-M173, folder #. Schlesinger Library, Radcliffe Institute, Harvard University, Cambridge, Mass.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHY
bioghist.p: Two Girls Working is a collaboration between two artists, Tiffany Ludwig and Renee Piechocki. Between 2001 and 2006, they traveled across the United States asking groups of women to respond to the question: What do you wear that makes you feel powerful? They talked with more than 500 women and girls, from age four to ninety-two, and from a wide range of backgrounds. What emerged was a wider dialogue about the expectations and limitations placed upon them by their affiliation with a specific gender, culture, race, class, or profession. The result was a project called Trappings: Stories of Women, Power and Clothing. The project included the interviews, exhibitions around the country, a book, and a web site.

scopecontent.head: SCOPE AND CONTENT
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of postcards, posters, and other publicity and printed material about Trappings.

did.unittitle:
Contents: Postcard Description: Front image features portraits of Aylin, Jersey City; Louise, Sparta; Susan, Jersey City; and Sarah, Patchogue.
Event / Exhibition Type: Group Exhibition Curator(s): Rob Blackson and Eddie Torres
Title: Bitch School; Artists Explore our Attitudes Towards Strong Women Informal Meta Title: None

Title: LOOM2 Informal Meta Title: None
Place: Pittsboro Business Center, Chatham Mills, 480 Hillsboro Street, Pittsboro, NC 27302 Start Date: 4/27/2002 End Date: 5/18/2002
Funding Notes: Other Notes: New interview sessions in Durham, NC were conducted for this exhibition. A small selection of participants was included in the exhibition. The site was formerly a clothing label factory.

Contents: Postcard Description: Front image: lower legs and feet of six women.

Contents: Postcard, two copies Description: Front image: portrait of Claire with interview quote.
Event / Exhibition Type: Solo Exhibition Curator(s): None. Selected by a jury who reviewed exhibition proposals.
Title: Trappings Informal Meta Title: None
Place: Durham Arts Council, 120 Morris Street, Durham, NC 27701 Start Date: 12/6/2002 End Date: 1/5/2003
Funding Notes: Other Notes: The exhibition opening was cancelled due to a terrible ice storm. A closing reception was hosted instead.

Contents: Print-out from internet Description: Description from Ricardo Miranda Zuniga's website. Also included is a photograph of the cart that broadcast the interviews.
Event / Exhibition Type: Public Art Curator(s): Ricardo Miranda Zuniga
Title: The Public Broadcast Cart, Wireless Park Lab Days Informal Meta Title: None
Place: City Hall Park, New York, NY 10171 Start Date: 9/19/2003 End Date: 9/20/2003
Funding Notes: Sponsored by NYCWireless and the Downtown Alliance with funding from Franklin Furnace's Future of the Present Fund.
Other Notes: The web page of the content: www.ambriente.com/wifi/index.php. Two Girls Working were one of many artists who were presented on the Public Broadcast Cart.

Contents: Folded card, two copies Description: Small images of all 21 Trappings interview sessions are on the front of the card, and a key is on the back. This postcard is a calendar of upcoming exhibitions, interviews, and residencies.
Event / Exhibition Type: N/A Curator(s): None.
Title: N/A Informal Meta Title: Trappings Update
Place: N/A, N/A, N/A Start Date: February 2004 End Date: March 2005
Funding Notes:
Other Notes: This card was mailed to more than 300 people on our mailing list, including all interview session participants. The purpose was to give people a Trappings calendar, letting them know what we were planning for the year ahead. It mentions an exhibition at the Yoknapatawpha Arts Council in Oxford, MS that never came to fruition.

Contents: Folded card, two copies; one postcard Description: Image on front of each card: "Antidote, Fetish, Talisman", 2004. Digital Print and Audio Work
Event / Exhibition Type: Solo Exhibition Curator(s): Rocio Aranda-Alvarado
Title: Trappings: Stories of Women, Power, and Clothing. An exhibition of print, audio and video By Two Girls Working: Tiffany Ludwig + Renee Piechocki Informal Meta Title: Jersey City
Place: Jersey City Museum, 350 Montgomery Street, Jersey City, NJ 07302 Start Date: 9/22/2004 End Date: 1/9/2005
Funding Notes: "This exhibition is the result of a residency with the Jersey City Museum funded by the Mid Atlantic Foundation's Artists and Communities grant."
Other Notes: The folded card and the postcard both included the telephone number used to present the audio work that accompanied "Antidote, Fetish, Talisman": 201-413-0303 x 130. The folded card was sent to our mailing list. The postcard was dropped off at local coffee shops and art spaces that advertised exhibitions and events. The museum would not let us print the exhibition opening information, so we put a stamp on the front of the envelope that held the folded card. Rocio Aranda-Alvarado is a Trappings participant.

Contents: Postcard, two copies Description: Image on front: black and white photograph by Martin Weber.
Event / Exhibition Type: Group Exhibition Curator(s): Ariel Shanberg
Title: Shifting the Political: Portraits of Power Informal Meta Title: None
Place: The Center for Photography at Woodstock, 59 Tinker Street, Woodstock, NY 12498 Start Date: 11/6/2004 End Date: 12/19/2004
Funding Notes: Other Notes:

Contents: Print-out from internet Description: Event listing from Jersey City List. Describes film screening.
Event / Exhibition Type: Film Screening Curator(s): Garth Kobal, a man who organized the film series at the church.
Title: Trappings: Stories of Women, Power, And Clothing: Interviews of Women at Grace Church Van Vorst Informal Meta Title: Jersey City
Place: Film at Grace, Grace Church Van Vorst, 39 Erie Street, Jersey City, NJ 07302 Start Date: 2/18/2005 End Date: 2/18/2005
Funding Notes: Other Notes: Three films were screened that night, "ProArts", "Belly Dancers", and "Grace Seniors", all created in 2004 and first exhibited at the Jersey City Museum exhibition.

Contents: Postcard Description: Image on front: black and white line drawing of bus, with photographic image insert of artists' prints installed
Event / Exhibition Type: Public Art Installation. Film Screening. Curator(s): None. Content curated by Two Girls Working.
Title: Trappings: Pittsburgh Informal Meta Title: Trappings: Pittsburgh
Place: Pittsburgh City Buses. Melwood Screening Room, 477 Melwood Avenue, Pittsburgh, PA 15213 Start Date: 3/1/2005 End Date: 4/3/2005
Funding Notes: Sprout Fund, Pennsylvania Council on the Arts
Other Notes: This postcard promoted both the public installation and video screening. The bus installation lasted from March 1-31, 2005. The screenings were on March 31st and April 3rd, 2005. The grant funding was for these public events as well as a series of interview sessions in Pittsburgh. The bus cards received national recognition from Americans for the Arts' Public Art Network 2005 Year in Review, which noted innovative and exciting public art projects.

Funding Notes:
Other Notes: This was the first time we traveled an exhibition and was paid for it. The show from Nashville International Airport was rented by the Bedford County Arts Council. We installed the exhibition. Renting the exhibition became the model for our national, traveling exhibition. We included this article in this section of the archive since no other exhibition materials exist.

controlaccess.head: Additional catalog entries
controlaccess.p: The following catalog entries represent persons, organizations, and topics documented in this collection. An entry for each appears in the Harvard On Line Library Information System (HOLLIS) and other automated bibliographic databases. THIS IS NOT AN INDEX.
